# Using the Terminal on Escape Pod {#using-the-terminal-on-escape-pod .title}

[](javascript:window.print() "Print this article"){.printArticle
aria-label="Print this Article"}

![](//d33v4339jhl8k0.cloudfront.net/docs/assets/5e3f0b1e2c7d3a7e9ae777f5/images/606382df0ad05379b10d2586/file-8XlH7IPCQT.gif){style="background-color: initial; width: 780px;"}

The Escape Pod offers several views during Onboarding that allow you to
use the visual interface, a command line interface, or both!

**Visual Interface:** The standard user experience. Great for easily and
quickly working through the Escape Pod onboarding process.\
**Command Line:** Great for fine tuning the onboarding process or using
built-in tools to dive deep into configuration.

::: {.section .callout-blue children-count="0"}
Please see the [Command Line: Commands &
Options](//support.digitaldreamlabs.com/article/374-escape-pod-command-line-commands){target="_blank"}
article for a complete list of command line tools available in the
Escape Pod!
:::

#### Key Combination Table {#key-combination-table style="text-align: center;" children-count="0"}

  Key Combination   Desired View
  ----------------- ------------------------------------------------------------------
  Alt + 1           Visual Interface Only
  Alt + 2           Combination Visual Interface (On Left) & Command Line (On Right)
  Alt + 3           Command Line Only

::: {.articleRatings article-url="https://support.digitaldreamlabs.com/article/372-switching-views-on-escape-pod"}
